name: W Los Angeles - Westwood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay here for two nights, even though the reviews were less than sparkling.
reviews.title: True Los Angeles Experience

reviews.text: First of all, this is a wonderful hotel. If you prefer the stylings of a Holiday Inn...do not stay here. If you are looking for something different and luxurious, then stay here.
reviews.title: Swanky Digs in Westwood

reviews.text: While we were here there was a designer sample sale (which my wife loved) and a taping of the HBO show Entourage. That's what this hotel is, Hollywood mixed with high style.
reviews.title: Must have got lucky...

reviews.text: Our room was perfect. A super comfortable living area (couch, tv, desk, bar area) and an intimate separate bedroom.
reviews.title: Trendy oasis in a busy city
Shabby chic, or just shabby and chic?
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a private,residential neighborhood away from the noise of the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The W Los Angeles – Westwood
reviews.title: Modern and chic! This is the place for the young single with money!

likes.liked: — Beautiful restaurant! Excellent food. Beautiful decor with sexy ambient lighting.
likes.disliked: — Very pricey, even for their basic room.

reviews.text: Time of stay: December 27, 2006
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

likes.liked: — Close to UCLA. Whatever Whenever - they really mean it.

reviews.text: Purpose of stay: leisure/pleasure
reviews.title: What you expect: good fro being hip and bad fro the same readon

likes.disliked: — The "scene" on Friday & Saturday nights; and the slow evelators

reviews.text: CHECK-IN:
reviews.title: Do not stay at this hotel!

reviews.text: - Staff were pleasant, helpful, and prompt in assisting us.
reviews.title: Over Rated!!

reviews.text: I am one of Starwood's most loyal guests, I have stayed in Starwood properties with work 57 nights in the past 9 months on 27 different stays, also stayed in W Sydney and W Chicago and I wanted to treat myself by rewarding points while travelling to LA.
reviews.title: W Hotel doesnt recognise loyal guests!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, when booking they told me they didnt have any standard room so I had to pay extra points to book a higher category, when arriving at the W hotel, the tall blond guy (its a W hotel, its standard) was rude and didnt acknowledge my requests, as a Platinium member I didnt have any upgrade, rather, I had one of the worst views, facind the inner courtyard. The hotel is currently being refurnished, so everywhere you go you see construction workers and when using the elevators; you take the "staff" one as the toehr ones are not always working.
reviews.title: Urban and Inviting

likes.disliked: — Dark stairs leading up to door. Think the entrance could emulate more light.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are quite big, but the one I had didnt have exterior lights so you almost had to turn on the lights 24/7. When doing the check out; the overcharged me for over 100 dollars, which they took off, but i realised afterward on my credit card statement that they still charged me for some extras ( in the mini bar i believe) that i didnt use.
reviews.title: Nice property

reviews.text: The property is nice; but the swimming pool is very small, the valet are rude (31 dollar per day). However the location is great, its in the middle of Westwood, close to Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and Westwood itself is nice, its where UCLA is and as a result its lively and full of nice restaurants and cafes.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The Concierge was very nice, she recommended some nice restaurants.
reviews.title: fab stay at the W

reviews.text: Hotel is Ok. Rooms are clean. Front Desk is ok. For the price I would stay somewhere else next time. Location is in a residential district. You need a car to get to anywhere....
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unique experience - if your into modern cold surroundings, your like this hotel. Don't expect any added value for being a Platinum or Gold Level Starwood holder -- it just will not happen. No upgrades, no benefits, no club lounge, etc. Hotel rooms were clean. Shower is excellent.
reviews.title: Very Different

reviews.text: I stayed at the W Hotel in Los Angeles for 2 nights in January. Everything was great. I live in LA about 1/2 mile away from the hotel but my house was being fumigated. We had a large suite with two living rooms. My 2 kids shared the sofa bed (which was pretty uncomfortable). I am a Starwood member and upon entering the room, there was a welcome bottle of wine along with mixed nuts from the GM of the hotel. It was such a nice surprise and I suppose that they gave this to us because we are Starwood members. On the second night there was a lovely box of chocolates at our bedside. I think these small touches make you feel welcome and want to return. Our room was lovely and it had the biggest, most comfortable and fluffy bed ever. I want to get the same exact bed for my home. The lobby and bar had the cool W vibe. I've stayed at the W in San Diego, W in Times Square and now the W in LA. I have enjoyed all the W Hotels and will continue booking rooms there.
reviews.title: Had a great two nights

reviews.text: Hallways and room are best summed up as having the appearance of 30 years of Spring Break cavorting without a cleaning, stains on all walls, carpets, and furniture, typical dark W hallways and rooms, poor towels, overpriced water ($8 per bottle), staff with attitude at the front desk, car valets were very good, flies join you for your beakfast without invite, food stains all over the restaurant menus each time the last three stays, $3.25 surcharge for using the ATM and limited to $100 (what will $100 buy you at a W hotel?), well below expectation for a Starwood Hotel, do yourself a favour, bring Lysol or stay somewhere else. Instead of taking photos of guests in the elevators, they should video their cleaning staff to determine what they have been doing. The US disease control unit should be called into this overpriced dormitory. The Bliss Spa was excellent though.
reviews.title: Once again, beat up and tired
First Class Experience
reviews.text: Was in town a few days for work, and the company put us up at the W. Exceptional place. The whole vibe is just really cool in every way. Friendly valet staff, beautiful and friendly checkin staff, huge room, cool bar, cool lobby, awesome machines in the gym, cool pool. the rooms are very special here, huge two room suites, with the most phenomonally comfortable bed I have ever stayed in. The minibar sells all kinds of neat little things, gift boxes of chocolate, w shirts and hats, and all kinds of neat beers, wines, and booze. Also, the tv in the living room has a cd player and comes with a W CD mix, really great sounds.

description: Our Luxury Los Angeles Hotel is at the foothills of Beverly Hills/Bel Air, squarely in the center of glamour, W Los Angeles Hotel Westwood is located between Rodeo Drive and the Santa Monica beaches.
